text:
Home » News » Nat’l Housing Programme: Fashola urges Rivers to waive N630m land compensation Nat’l Housing Programme: Fashola urges Rivers to waive N630m land compensation On 4:26 am In News by Okogba Comments 
By Emma Amaize 
P ORT HARCOURT — MINISTER of Works, Power and Housing, Mr. Babatunde Fashola, has called on the Rivers State Government to put aside the compensation of N630 million being demanded from the Federal Government for the land allocated to the ministry for a federal housing programme in the state. 
Fashola, who concluded an assessment tour of federal roads under his ministry in the South-South region with the inspection of ongoing road projects in Edo and Delta states, weekend, made the appeal when he visited the governor of Rivers State, Mr Nyesom Wike, in Port Harcourt, the state capital. 
He told the governor, who was represented by his deputy, Dr. Ipalibo Banigo, that as part of the plans to commence the National Housing Programme, the ministry resolved to use the land already allocated to it by the state government, but the demand for outrageous compensation of N630 million was affecting the take-off. 
The minister stated that if the N630 million was not set aside, the obvious reality is that the cost would be passed on to the eventual users, who are workers in the state, lamenting that such development would defeat the purpose of the housing programme.
